summaryText: Wow, what an incredible testimony of God's faithfulness! Pastor Travis Hearn shares a powerful narrative of Impact Church's journey from humble beginnings to experiencing 'immeasurably more' than they could have ever imagined. Can you believe they started with just 204 people in 2010 and now have over 10,000 attending? PT walks us through the church's miraculous growth, highlighting moments where God's provision seemed impossible - like being on the brink of foreclosure and then receiving unprecedented bank mercy. The most inspiring part? Their unwavering commitment to the vision of impacting lives for God's kingdom. From a rough building with broken AC units to a thriving multi-service church, Impact Church demonstrates that when you're faithful, God can do infinitely more than you could ever ask or dream. The sermon isn't just about church growth; it's about believing in a God who 'calls things that are not as though they are' and trusting His supernatural ability to transform seemingly hopeless situations.
mainPoints: God can do immeasurably more than we can ask or imagine
Faithfulness and vision are crucial in seeing God's promises fulfilled
Our purpose is to impact people for God's kingdom

versesMentioned.text: Now to him who is able to do immeasurably more than all we can ask or imagine, according to his power that is at work within us, to him be the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus throughout all generations, forever and ever! Amen.
As it is written: 'I have made you a father of many nations.' He is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed—the God who gives life to the dead and calls into being things that were not.
The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.
Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.
So that you may become blameless and pure, 'children of God without fault in a warped and crooked generation.' Then you will shine among them like stars in the sky.

You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.

Monday.scripture: Ephesians 3:20: 'Now to him who is able to do immeasurably more than all we can ask or imagine, according to his power that is at work within us'
Monday.action: Write down three areas in your life where you feel stuck or hopeless. Pray over these areas, asking God to do 'immeasurably more'.
Monday.prayer: Lord, I surrender these areas to You. Help me to believe that You are capable of doing far beyond what I can imagine. Increase my faith and help me trust in Your unlimited power. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Romans 4:17: 'God who gives life to the dead and calls into being things that were not'
Tuesday.focus: Speaking life into seemingly impossible situations
Tuesday.action: Choose one challenging situation in your life and begin speaking positive, faith-filled declarations over it daily.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, teach me to speak life. Help me see beyond current circumstances and declare Your promises. Give me the faith to believe in transformation. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 18:21: 'The tongue has the power of life and death'
Wednesday.action: Track your speech for a day. Notice how often you speak negatively versus positively. Commit to speaking more words of encouragement.
Wednesday.prayer: God, make me aware of my words. Help me use my speech to build up, encourage, and bring life to those around me. Purify my tongue. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Matthew 28:19: 'Go and make disciples of all nations'
Thursday.action: Identify one person in your circle who needs spiritual guidance. Pray about how you might disciple or mentor them.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, show me who needs Your love and guidance. Give me courage and wisdom to be a light in their life. Use me to make a difference. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Philippians 2:15: 'Shine among them like stars in the sky'
Friday.action: Look for an opportunity to serve someone unexpectedly. Do something kind without seeking recognition.
Friday.prayer: Father, help me shine Your light today. Make me an instrument of Your love and grace. Let my actions reflect Your character. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Matthew 5:16: 'Let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven'
Saturday.action: Reflect on the past week. Journal about how you've seen God working and where you can improve in being His representative.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, examine my heart. Show me areas where I can more authentically represent You. Help me live in a way that brings glory to Your name. Amen.
